title: WeCareAdvisor: A Web-Based Tool to Improve Quality of Life for Military Veterans With Dementia and Their Caregivers
description_brief: This research will test the WeCareAdvisor tool for family caregivers of military veterans with dementia to help caregivers assess, manage and track behavioral symptoms and their contributing factors (e.g., pain, sleep disturbance), and that provides tailored strategies for in-home, medication-free behavior management. 60 caregiver-person with dementia dyads will be recruited (30 Treatment Group, 30 Wait-List Control Group).
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is WeCareAdvisor, a web-based, caregiver-focused platform that uses the DICE approach to help caregivers assess, manage, and track behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia (BPSD) and provides tailored, in-home, medication-free strategies — i.e., a non-pharmacologic behavioral intervention targeting neuropsychiatric/behavioral symptoms. citeturn0search9turn0search2

Act (extracted details): The trial tests the WeCareAdvisor behavioral tool (no drug or placebo). The described study recruits caregiver–person-with-dementia dyads (60 dyads, 30 treatment/30 wait-list) focusing on military veterans with dementia. The intervention is explicitly behavioral/nonpharmacologic. citeturn0search5turn0search2

Reflect (verification): WeCareAdvisor was developed to reduce caregiver distress and the frequency/severity of BPSD and has been evaluated in pilot RCTs showing reductions in caregiver distress and BPSD frequency/severity; these aims and results confirm the correct category is neuropsychiatric symptom improvement rather than a disease-modifying biologic/small molecule or a cognitive enhancer. citeturn0search1turn0search3
